isis.stitle: TSI 07-12-16RA - Remote Fuel/Water Separator Installation With 150 Watt Electric Heater, Water In Fuel Sensor, Fuel Restriction Switch And Optional Coolant Heat Exchanger

subjectgroup.subject: Remote Fuel/Water Separator Installation With 150 Watt Electric Heater, Water In Fuel Sensor, Fuel Restriction Switch And Optional Coolant Heat Exchanger

geninfo.para: This procedure describes the necessary steps to install a remote mounted fuel/water separator to prevent premature engine fuel strainer and fuel filter plugging on the above listed models.

partsinfo.para: A fuel/water separator kit (Table 1), mounting bracket and hardware for the appropriate location (determined by the available space you have to install the fuel water separator) (Table 2), a harness (Table 3), required hoses (Table 4) and inline fuel filter and fittings for dual fuel tanks if equipped (Table 5) will need to be ordered.

para.emph: Fuel/water separator with 150W electric heat and coolant heat exchanger for cold climates

entry.para: 12" Hg vacuum switch for VT356 − Tan
7" Hg vacuum switch for I-6 − Black

para.emph: Frame Rail Back of Cab Mounting
4300/4400 Optional Engine Compartment Mounting on RH Frame Rail (Recommended for Coolant Heat)

entry.para: ¾" Coolant hose (Only required with coolant heat kit, 2596813C91)

table.title: Inline Fuel Filter and Fittings for Dual Fuel Tanks

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death, shift transmission to neutral or park, set parking brake, and block wheels before doing diagnostic or service procedures.

step1.para: Disconnect the battery negative cable.
Install additional inline fuel filter on vehicles equipped with dual fuel tanks per "Inline Fuel Filter Installation for Dual Fuel Tanks" section later in these instructions.
Install the correct fuel restriction switch in the fuel/water separator outlet tee.

item.para: I-6 engines use switch part number 1809435C1 (Black in color)
VT 365 engines use switch part number 2596815C1 (Tan in color)

step1.para: Secure fuel/water separator mounting bracket to fuel/water separator with 3/8" x 1" bolts and lock washers. Drill an additional 3/8" mounting hole in bracket if the fuel/water separator mounting holes do not align.

Back of Cab Mounting Only - Locate a position on the frame rail close to the draw (main) fuel tank to mount the fuel/water separator and bracket utilizing existing cross member mounting holes if possible. Mount fuel/water separator and bracket assembly to frame with 30752R2 bolts and 30756R1 nuts (Figure 1 and Figure 5).

Engine Compartment Mounting Only - Remove RH splash shield and fender extension for access. Mount remote fuel/water separator assembly to RH frame rail with 1680392C1 bolts using existing holes in frame rail 6" forward of the shock absorber mounting bracket (Figure 2). Reposition A/C hose toward the engine to prevent chafing on fuel/water separator bracket if needed.

note.para: In some applications the fuel/water separator assembly may need to be lowered ¾" on the mounting bracket to gain clearance for the alternator.

step1.para: Route 417200C3 1/2" Nylon hose from the inlet port of the fuel/water separator to the fuel outlet connection (black hose) on top of the draw (main) fuel tank. Cut hose to length.

Install a Voss male connector (straight or 90 degree dependent on hose routing) on the fuel/water separator end of the fuel inlet hose and a 90 degree Voss male connector on the fuel tank end. Refer to TSI 04-15-01 for Voss fuel line connector installation instructions. Route the newly fabricated hose from the top of the draw (main) tank to the fuel/water separator. Disconnect the black fuel outlet hose from the draw fuel tank stand pipe. Connect the Voss 90 degree connector to the fuel tank standpipe fitting. Connect the other Voss male connector to the INLET port of the remote fuel/water separator. Refer to Figures 1 - 3 for proper fuel hose connections.

FOR I-6 ENGINES ONLY Route 417200C3 1/2" Nylon hose from the outlet port of the fuel/water separator to the black fuel hose on top of the draw (main) fuel tank previously removed from the fuel tank standpipe in Step 8. Cut hose to length. Install 3551188C1 Voss straight female connector on the fuel tank end the hose and Voss male connector (straight or 90 degree dependent on hose routing) on the fuel/water separator end. Route the new hose from the fuel/water separator to the top of the draw (main) fuel tank. Connect the Voss straight female connector to the black fuel hose previously removed in Step 8. Connect the Voss male connector on the fuel outlet hose to the OUTLET fitting on the fuel/water separator assembly. Refer to Figures 1 - 3 for proper fuel hose connections.

(With VT 365 Only) . THE FUEL/WATER SEPARATOR OUTLET HOSE MUST BE ROUTED DIRECTLY FROM THE FUEL/WATER SEPARATOR WITH A STRAIGHT VOSS FITTING TO THE ENGINE FUEL PUMP OR EXCESSIVE FUEL RESTRICTION WILL RESULT. Route 417200C3 1/2" Nylon hose from the outlet port of the fuel/water separator to the engine fuel supply pump on the right side of the engine. Cut hose to length. Install a Voss straight male connector on the fuel/water separator end of the fuel outlet hose and 90 degree Voss male connector on the engine end. Route the new hose from the fuel/water separator to the engine lift pump following the existing fuel lines. Disconnect the fuel inlet hose on the engine lift pump and connect the 90 degree Voss male connector on the fuel/water separator outlet hose to the inlet port of the pump. Connect the Voss straight male connector on the fuel/water separator outlet hose to the OUTLET fitting on the fuel/water separator assembly. Install caps removed from the new Voss fittings on the ends of the factory installed fuel hose at fuel pump and fuel tank and tie back hose. Refer to Figure 4 and 5 for proper fuel hose connections.

Secure the fuel hoses and protect fuel lines as needed to prevent rubbing against sharp, hot or moving parts. For an engine compartment mounted fuel/water separator a hose support bracket and clamp must be added to the rear of RH cab mounting bracket using an existing hole in the frame rail as shown in Figure 6 and a clamp on the RH cab front support bracket as shown in Figure 7.
Remove the engine fuel filter strainer. Clean the strainer and housing and re-install.

FOR FUEL/WATER SEPARATOR ASSEMBLIES WITH COOLANT HEAT EXCHANGER ONLY Drain cooling system or block off the HVAC heater coolant lines. Cut and install the ¾" coolant tees in an appropriate area using supplied spring hose clamps. Route ¾" heater hoses from the installed tees to the fuel/water separator heat exchanger coolant ports. Use caution to avoid sharp, moving or hot components. Install heater hose spring clamps and refill cooling system. Secure hoses as needed. Refer to Figure 8.
Install the FUEL WATER SEPARATOR decal on the engine fuel filter housing.
Install overlay harness, program and test system per "Installation of the Fuel / Water Separator Overlay Harness" section below.

svcproc.title: Installation of the Fuel / Water Separator Overlay Harness

step1.para: Install the power wire eyelet (grey wire labeled fusible link) of the overlay harness to the non-fused side (forward stud) of the mega fuse (Figure 9).
Install the ground (white wire) eyelet to the cab ground stud (Figure 10).
Remove ESC connector 4004 (lower ESC connector outside of cab). Insert the tan wire into ESC cavity 11. Insert the blue wire into cavity 14. If a wire is in cavity 11 or 14, remove and tie back.
Refer to Figure 11 for the following:
 Vehicles with Air Brakes:

item.para: Insert the pink wire into ESC connector position 28 and reinstall connector 4004 into the ESC

step1.para:  Vehicles with Hydraulic Brakes:

item.para: All vehicles except vehicles built before 8/19/2002 with dual fuel tanks -
Insert the pink overlay harness wire into ESC connector position 32 and reinstall connector 4004 into the ESC.
Vehicles built before 8/19/2002 with dual fuel tanks ONLY - (5 pin fuel transfer pump)
Cut terminal off existing terminal of the pink wire and add an additional 30 inches of 18 gauge wire.
Install a 1661208C1 terminal on the end of the additional wire.
Remove the PDC assembly from the mounting bracket by releasing the lock tabs on the bottom of the box.
Remove the PDC cover and remove the cable restraints from the PDC box sides.
Lift the fuse and relay blocks from the PDC box. The ends of the box must be pried apart (one end at a time) to release the PDC lock tabs.
Locate the ignition bus on the underside of the PDC. Cut the tie strap holding the ignition bus and carefully pull the bus away from the PDC as shown in Figures 12 and 13.
Remove the bus cover and bus bar shown in Figure 13.
Insert lengthened pink wire from fuel/water separator overlay harness in an empty cavity of the ignition bus bar connector.
Re-insert the bus bar into the holder.
Re-install the bus cover.
Reposition the ignition bus to the backside of the PDC and tie strap in place.
Reassemble the PDC in the engine compartment.

step1.para: Route the overlay harness to the remote fuel /water separator avoiding sharp, hot or moving parts. Secure the overlay harness with tie straps as needed.
Connect the wires to the heater, high fuel restriction switch and water in fuel probe on the remote fuel /water separator (connectors are different sizes and will only fit on the correct terminal).
Reconnect the negative battery cable.
Reprogram the ESC. Refer to Table 7.

entry.para: Vehicles with ESC serial number greater than 16,000,000 and 595291 installed
Vehicles with ESC serial number greater than 16,000,000 and without feature 595291 installed
Vehicles with ESC serial number less than 16,000,000
All hydraulic brake vehicles except vehicles built before 8/19/2002 with dual fuel tanks (5 pin fuel transfer pump).

step1.para: Check for proper operation.

item.para: With the ignition off, 0 volts will be present at the remote fuel/water separator heater connector.
With the ignition on, 12 ± 1.5 volts will be present at the remote fuel/water separator heater connector.

With the ignition on, disconnect and ground the water in fuel wire at the remote fuel/water separator. The WATER IN FUEL light in the EGC should illuminate when the terminal is grounded and turn off when the wire is not grounded. Reconnect the wire.

Vehicles with feature 595043 only - With the ignition on, disconnect and ground the wire at the fuel restriction switch on the remote fuel/water separator. The FUEL FILTER light in the EGC should illuminate when the terminal is grounded and turn off when the wire is not grounded. Reconnect the wire.

step1.para: Prime fuel system, start engine and check for any leaks.

svcproc.title: Inline Fuel Filter Installation for Dual Fuel Tanks

step1.para: Install a 3533424C2 Voss adapter on each port of a 3589708C1 fuel filter.
Install a 3533426C2 Voss connector on each end of a 2 1/2" section of 417200C3 1/2" Nylon hose.
Connect short fuel line fabricated in step 12 to the outlet port of inline fuel filter. This is the port the FLOW arrow is pointing to. Refer to Figure 14.

Disconnect the inlet fuel hose to the fuel transfer pump on the frame rail above the fuel tank. Slide this hose back in the support clamp about 12". Connect this hose to the inline fuel filter inlet port. Connect the short fuel hose to the inlet of the fuel transfer pump. Refer to Figure 15.
Inspect all fuel lines for chafing and repair as needed.
